get.summary: Describes the specified attribute of the specified instance.

parameters.name: Attribute
parameters.description: The instance attribute.

parameters.name: DryRun
parameters.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request,        and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation.        Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

parameters.description: The ID of the instance.

parameters.description: One or more instance IDs.

parameters.name: MaxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return for the request in atttsingle page. The remaining results of thetttinitial request can be seen by sending another request with the returnedttttNextToken value. This value can be between 5 and 1000; ifttttMaxResults is given a value larger than 1000, only 1000 results are returned. Youtttcannot specify this parameter and the instance IDs parameter in the same request.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: The token to request the next page of results.

parameters.name: IncludeAllInstances
parameters.description: When true, includes the health status for all instances.ttttWhen false, includes the health status for running instances only.

parameters.name: InstanceId.N
parameters.description: One or more instance IDs.

parameters.name: MaxResults
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return for the request in a   ttsingle page. The remaining results of the   ttinitial request can be seen by sending another request with the returned   ttNextToken value. This value can be between 5 and 1000; if   ttMaxResults is given a value larger than 1000, only 1000 results are returned.tttYou cannot specify this parameter and the instance IDs parameter in the same request.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: The token to retrieve the next page of results.

get.summary: Modifies the specified attribute of the specified instance.
get.description: Modifies the specified attribute of the specified instance.

parameters.name: Attribute
parameters.description: The name of the attribute.

parameters.name: BlockDeviceMapping.N
parameters.description: Modifies the DeleteOnTermination attribute for volumesttttthat are currently attached. The volume must be owned by the caller. Ifttttno value is specified for DeleteOnTermination, the defaultttttis true and the volume is deleted when the instance isttttterminated.

parameters.name: DisableApiTermination
parameters.description: If the value is true, you cant terminate the instance using the Amazon EC2      console, CLI, or API; otherwise, you can. You cannot use this paramater for Spot      Instances.

parameters.name: DryRun
parameters.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request,        and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation.        Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

parameters.name: EbsOptimized
parameters.description: Specifies whether the instance is optimized for EBS I/O. This optimizationttttprovides dedicated throughput to Amazon EBS and an optimizedttttconfiguration stack to provide optimal EBS I/O performance. Thisttttoptimization isnt available with all instance types. Additional usagettttcharges apply when using an EBS Optimized instance.

parameters.name: GroupId.N
parameters.description: [EC2-VPC] Changes the security groups of the instance. You must specifyttttat least one security group, even if its just the default securityttttgroup for the VPC. You must specify the security group ID, not thettttsecurity group name.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The ID of the instance.

parameters.name: InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior
parameters.description: Specifies whether an instance stops or terminates when you initiatettttshutdown from the instance (using the operating system command for system shutdown).

parameters.name: InstanceType
parameters.description: Changes the instance type to the specified value. For more information, seettttInstance Types.ttttIf the instance type is not valid, the error returned is InvalidInstanceAttributeValue.

parameters.name: Kernel
parameters.description: Changes the instances kernel to the specified value. We recommend that you use PV-GRUBtttinstead of kernels and RAM disks. For more information, see PV-GRUB.

parameters.name: Ramdisk
parameters.description: Changes the instances RAM disk to the specified value. We recommend that you use PV-GRUB     tinstead of kernels and RAM disks. For more information, see PV-GRUB.

parameters.name: SourceDestCheck
parameters.description: Specifies whether source/destination checking is enabled.ttttA value of true means that checking is enabled, andttttfalse means checking is disabled. This valuettttmust be false for a NAT instance to perform NAT.

parameters.name: SriovNetSupport
parameters.description: Set to simple to enable enhanced networking for the instance.

parameters.name: UserData
parameters.description: Changes the instances user data to the specified value.

parameters.name: Value
parameters.description: A new value for the attribute. Use only with the kernel, ramdisk,        userData, disableApiTermination, or        instanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior attribute.

get.summary: Submits feedback about the status of an instance.
get.description: Submits feedback about the status of an instance.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: Descriptive text about the health state of your instance.

parameters.name: DryRun
parameters.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request,        and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation.        Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

parameters.name: EndTime
parameters.description: The time at which the reported instance health state ended.

parameters.name: InstanceId.N
parameters.description: One or more instances.

parameters.name: ReasonCode.N
parameters.description: One or more reason codes that describes the health state of your instance.

parameters.name: StartTime
parameters.description: The time at which the reported instance health state began.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: The status of all instances listed.

get.summary: Launches the specified number of instances using an AMI for which you have permissions.
get.description: Launches the specified number of instances using an AMI for which you have permissions.

parameters.name: AdditionalInfo
parameters.description: Reserved.

parameters.name: BlockDeviceMapping.N
parameters.description: The block device mapping.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: Unique, case-sensitive identifier you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. For more information,     see Ensuring Idempotency.

parameters.name: DisableApiTermination
parameters.description: If you set this parameter to true, you cant terminate the instance using the Amazon EC2      console, CLI, or API; otherwise, you can. If you set this parameter to true and then later want      to be able to terminate the instance, you must first change the value of the      disableApiTermination attribute to false using      ModifyInstanceAttribute. Alternatively, if you set      InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior to terminate,      you can terminate the instance by running the shutdown command from the instance.

parameters.name: DryRun
parameters.description: Checks whether you have the required permissions for the action, without actually making the request,        and provides an error response. If you have the required permissions, the error response is DryRunOperation.        Otherwise, it is UnauthorizedOperation.

parameters.name: EbsOptimized
parameters.description: Indicates whether the instance is optimized for EBS I/O. This optimization     provides dedicated throughput to Amazon EBS and an optimized     configuration stack to provide optimal EBS I/O performance. This     optimization isnt available with all instance types. Additional usage     charges apply when using an EBS-optimized instance.

parameters.name: IamInstanceProfile
parameters.description: The IAM instance profile.

parameters.name: ImageId
parameters.description: The ID of the AMI, which you can get by calling DescribeImages.

parameters.name: InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior
parameters.description: Indicates whether an instance stops or terminates when you initiate     shutdown from the instance (using the operating system command for system shutdown).

parameters.name: InstanceType
parameters.description: The instance type. For more information, see Instance Types in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.

parameters.name: KernelId
parameters.description: The ID of the kernel.

parameters.name: KeyName
parameters.description: The name of the key pair. You can create a key pair using CreateKeyPair or ImportKeyPair.

parameters.name: MaxCount
parameters.description: The maximum number of instances to launch. If you specify more instances     than Amazon EC2 can launch in the target Availability Zone, Amazon EC2 launches the     largest possible number of instances above MinCount.

parameters.name: MinCount
parameters.description: The minimum number of instances to launch. If you specify a minimum that is more instances     than Amazon EC2 can launch in the target Availability Zone, Amazon EC2 launches no instances.

parameters.name: Monitoring
parameters.description: The monitoring for the instance.

parameters.name: NetworkInterface.N
parameters.description: One or more network interfaces.

parameters.name: Placement
parameters.description: The placement for the instance.

parameters.name: PrivateIpAddress
parameters.description: [EC2-VPC] The primary IP address. You must specify a value     from the IP address range of the subnet.

parameters.name: RamdiskId
parameters.description: The ID of the RAM disk.

parameters.name: SecurityGroup.N
parameters.description: [EC2-Classic, default VPC] One or more security group names. For a nondefault VPC, you must use     security group IDs instead.

parameters.name: SecurityGroupId.N
parameters.description: One or more security group IDs. You can create a security group using CreateSecurityGroup.

parameters.name: SubnetId
parameters.description: [EC2-VPC] The ID of the subnet to launch the instance into.

parameters.name: UserData
parameters.description: The Base64-encoded MIME user data for the instances.
